translation.handText: Specify the affected skin area using the palm method, both front and back.
translation.popupInfoText:
Specify REDNESS, THICKNESS, SCALING on the affected area. If different psoriasis patches have different characteristics, try to find an average for the area. The area involved is estimated using the palm method (PSA palm-surface-area). One palm (without fingers) = one PSA.


THICKNESS implies that you assess how raised lesions are. Use your fingers to see if you can feel the edge of the lesions. Please note that BUTTOCKS are part of the LEGS.

generalInfo.backgroundText: PsoCalc has been created on the initiative of Albert Duvetorp at the Dept of Dermatology at Skåne University Hospital. The project has been financially supported by ABBVIE and was carried out in collaboration with Webexpress Stockholm.
generalInfo.whyText: Everyone studying psoriasis in the skin needs to be able to estimate disease activity in a simple way. We want to help through this open-source project. Our goal is for the web application to be used as it is or adapted to the user's own study.
generalInfo.licensText: zPASI can be used according to CC-BY 4.0. The web application's code according to the MIT License for open-source code. You are free to use and modify the web application's code. We wish that you credit the creators.

mathematicalFoundation.BSAText: Is calculated based on the following assumptions. A. Head-neck-neck accounts for 10% of the total skin surface area. B. Arms and hands account for 20% of the total skin surface area. C. Torso (abdomen, chest, back) accounts for 30% of the total skin surface  area. D. Legs, buttocks and feet account for 40% of the total skin area. E. Palm Surface Area (PSA) accounts for 0.5% of the total skin area. PSA being the area of palm of the person with psoriasis (hand without fingers).
mathematicalFoundation.PASIText: Is calculated based on the method described by Fredriksson and Pettersson Dermatologica 157: 238 -244 (1978). In the web application, calculations are also based on assumptions made for BSA.
mathematicalFoundation.zPASIText: Modified PASI where the AREA score in the PASI calculation is calculated according to the following formula:
mathematicalFoundation.procent: a% corresponds to % of the affected area (head, arms, torso, legs) covered with psoriasis.

disclaimer.disclaimerText: The creators of this web application disclaim legal responsibility for its use/application. The web application is not a registered medical device. The user should use the web application critically and is responsible for ensuring that the calculations are performed correctly.
